item.title: The Best Games Where You Manage A Guild Of Heroes
item.description:
Managing a proper guild of heroes is not just about sending brave adventurers into some dark dungeons and just hoping they come back with oodles of loot. It's truly about recruiting them, training them up, and, yeah, sometimes burying those same poor heroes when things go horribly wrong.

These games hand players the responsibility of keeping a whole roster alive and actually thriving, balancing precious resources, wildly differing personalities, and danger at every turn. Some of them lean into pure strategy and cold numbers, while others are more about chunky roleplay and fantastic storytelling, but all of them scratch that very same itch of running the ultimate adventuring organisation.

Epic Manager

Fantasy Football Meets Fantasy RPG

  • Platform(s) : PC
  • Released : December 12, 2016
  • Developer(s) : ManaVoid Entertainment
  • Genre(s) : Simulator, RPG

When classic sports management sims and fantasy RPGs collide, the result is Epic Manager . Players act as a talent agency for heroes. They’re scouting adventurers, recruiting them to the guild, and then sending them off on quests for fame and fortune. The game’s rather excellent humor keeps things light, even as players juggle fiddly contracts, fickle reputations, and genuinely dangerous missions.

However, the real charm of Epic Manager lies in the personality it infuses into the management aspect of adventuring. Negotiating pay with a grumpy would-be hero, deciding which jobs to bravely take, and actually racing rival agencies to complete contracts. It all feels surprisingly fresh and super competitive. It’s less about tediously crawling through endless dungeons and more about building the most successful business of heroes in the entire kingdom.

Darkest Dungeon

Heroes Will Break Before They Die

Darkest Dungeon
9 /10
8.6 /10
Released
January 19, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Alcohol Reference, Blood and Gore, Mild Language, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Red Hook Studios
Powered by

Few games make guild management quite as stressful as Darkest Dungeon . Players recruit heroes to explore nightmarish, eldritch dungeons, but the real battle isn't just against grotesque horrors. It's against crushing stress, debilitating phobias, and the sheer mental toll of the whole journey. Heroes can pick up some truly bizarre quirks, develop nasty obsessions, and even outright refuse to follow orders if they just plain break.

Managing a guild here means constant, intense damage control. Dozens of recruits may well be needed to rotate through missions, while others desperately recover in the tavern or abbey. But that’s part of what makes every single success so incredibly rewarding. Darkest Dungeon turns guild leadership into a desperate, nail-biting struggle for survival.

Guild Of Dungeoneering

Build The Dungeon Around Your Heroes

Guild of Dungeoneering
Roguelike
Systems
Released
July 14, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone: Alcohol Reference, Mild Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Gambrinous
Powered by

Instead of directly controlling heroes, Guild of Dungeoneering takes a completely hands-off approach. Players lay out dungeon rooms, pop in some monsters, add some treasure, and then just watch as their heroes comically bumble through the maze. It’s equal parts clever strategy and laugh-out-loud comedy, with heroes making some hilariously bad decisions that players simply must plan around.

The game’s rather unique paper-cutout art style and that wonderfully snarky bard narration give it a personality all its very own. Expanding the guild means unlocking cool new hero classes and upgrades, which then opens up even more ways to accidentally get them killed. It's a fantastic mix of management and lighthearted chaos that genuinely makes each run memorable.

Adventurer Manager

Classic RPG Guild Administration

  • Platform(s) : PC
  • Released : December 4, 2014
  • Developer(s) : Vigilant Addiction Studios
  • Genre(s) : RPG

Adventurer Manager feels like it could've been an old-school shareware game from the nineties, and that's absolutely part of its charm. Players hire adventurers, equip them with their best gear, and then send them on turn-based dungeon crawls, all while focusing on improving the town and unlocking new shops.

Its real appeal comes from that numbers-driven gameplay. Leveling up heroes, meticulously customizing their builds, and just watching the guild grow steadily over time. It might not have all those flashy visuals, but it hands players a proper sense of control over every single aspect of guild life, right down to optimizing party compositions for maximum efficiency.

Heroes Of A Broken Land

A World That Needs A Guild

  • Platform(s) : PC
  • Released : August 7, 2014
  • Developer(s) : Winged Pixel Inc.
  • Genre(s) : RPG

This hidden gem wonderfully combines classic dungeon crawling with proper world-building. In Heroes of a Broken Land , players recruit adventurers, but they also rebuild villages and expand their influence across a shattered world map. It blends management with exciting exploration, with each dungeon dive helping restore a tiny bit more of the broken land.

What truly makes it special is the sheer scope. Multiple parties can be sent on different missions at once. Players must balance which areas to explore, which towns to painstakingly rebuild, and which heroes to level first. It feels just like running an entire adventuring enterprise in a living, breathing world, one dungeon at a time.

Dungeons 3

When The Guildmaster Is The Villain

Dungeons 3
7.0 /10
Released
October 13, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

In Dungeons 3 , players aren't hiring heroes at all. They're actually hiring orcs, demons, and dark elves to fight against the so-called forces of good. It’s a perfect, delightful twist on the genre, letting players manage an evil army, dig out elaborate dungeon lairs, and then send raiding parties to terrorize the overworld.

Managing a guild of villains, believe it or not, can be just as challenging as managing heroes. Units need gold, traps need building, and pesky heroes will constantly invade to wreck everything players have so carefully set up. But the brilliant humor and snarky narration make the grind genuinely enjoyable, turning every single dungeon defence into a gleefully evil spectacle.

Knights Of Pen And Paper 2

Tabletop Guild Adventures

Knights Of Pen And Paper 2
RPG
Systems
Released
May 13, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E for Everyone - Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Kyy Games
Powered by

This meta-RPG cleverly turns guild management into an actual tabletop session. Knights of Pen and Paper 2 puts players in control of not just the heroes, but the actual Dungeon Master too. This lets them tweak encounters, recruit brand new classes, and customize their in-game room for extra bonuses.

Its writing is packed full of self-aware jokes and tons of pop culture references, which makes the grind lighthearted and genuinely fun. But the real joy comes from balancing party composition and taking on harder quests for better rewards, all while slowly upgrading the guild hall to support even more heroes. Its management is deliciously wrapped in charming tabletop nostalgia.

item.title: Demon’s Souls Gets New Update for October 2025
item.description:
Demon's Souls has received a new update in October 2025, bringing the game to version 1.007.000. The update follows up on a fairly recent update to the PlayStation 5, which enables a new PlayStation feature for Demon's Souls .

A 2020 remake of the original PS3 game, Demon's Souls was received as a major success following years of fan demand for it to happen. While the game has largely become dormant with a lack of significant updates in recent times, a new one has now released, which gives players a different way to enjoy the game.

Demon's Souls Releases 1.007.000 Update

Demon's Souls has now been updated to version 1.007, which has given the game the ability to be played with the new Power Saver function on PlayStation 5. The Power Saver mode was added to PlayStation 5 consoles back in September 2025, but only a few games have announced plans to utilize it. One of these was Demon's Souls , which has now made good on its promise, while the remaining games are Death Stranding 2: On the Beach , and Ghost of Yotei . Those who haven't used the Power Saver feature yet and want to check it out can enable it easily. Players just need to go to the settings screen, then system, power saving, and then enable the Power Saver mode. At this time, it's not known what other games will be added to the Power Saving-compatible list or when they'll be added.

Cutting how much energy the PlayStation 5 uses while playing Demon's Souls does come at a cost, of course. According to numerous reports, the game caps out at 30 frames per second while in Power Saving mode, and the game is displayed at a lower resolution. It's a far cry from the 60FPS and 4K the PlayStation 5 is capable of, but it may be a good option for those who are trying to save energy or reduce how much heat their PS5 produces. One analysis found that the PlayStation 5 went from using about 230W playing the game normally down to 100W with Power Saver enabled, cutting power consumption dramatically.

PlayStation and Sony have been taking steps to reduce energy consumption and to be more environmentally friendly. However, some also suspect that PlayStation could also be working on technology to reduce energy while maintaining the best possible performance for its rumored handheld. While unconfirmed, the alleged handheld would presumably use considerably less energy than a powerful home console, like the Steam Deck or the ROG Xbox Ally X.

8.3 /10
10 /10

Demon's Souls

item.title: How to Use Sachet and Evolve Spritzee in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
You're here because you either a) got your hands on a Sachet in Pokemon Legends Z-A and aren't sure what Pokemon it can be used on, or B) you have caught a Spritzee and are trying to figure out how to evolve it into Aromatisse.

In this Pokemon Legends Z-A guide, we'll show you where to find Sachets and how you can use them to evolve Spritzee .

How to Catch Spritzee in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

Look on Trucks

Spritzee can actually be found throughout the entire city of Lumiose , but it tends to hang out on top of trucks and other elevated places . We managed to find one on top of the Nouveau Cafe Truck (No. 2) in the Bleu District (shown in the images above).

How to Evolve Spritzee in Pokemon Legends: Z-A (Sachet)

Find a Friend

In order to evolve Spritzee into Aromatisse in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , you need to give it an item called a ' Sachet ' and trade the Pokemon with another player . When it comes to trading, you can either Link Trade with a friend you trust to give you the Aromatisse back, or you can use this code ( 0096-0096 ) to find other players who are also trying to evolve their Spritzee.

Now, to get the Sachet item, we managed to get two as a reward for completing Side Mission #10: Skiddo's Fragrant Leaves. All you need to do to complete it is show Odette a Skiddo.

If you've yet to catch Skiddo, you can find some in Wild Zone 3.

She'll give you two Sachets, five Persim berries, and some Poke Dollars. You should be able to find the mission in the Bleu Sector south of the Stone Emporium.

Once you have a Sachet, just give it to your Spritzee to hold , then initiate a trade with someone to trigger the evolution.

16
4.9 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Best Armor Sets In Ghost Of Tsushima (& How To Get Them)
item.description:
Armor is a fun way to customize how Jin looks in Ghost of Tsushima and get some much-needed boosts to help you defeat the Mongol invaders. No matter what play style you have, there is an armor set that will match and give you benefits that help further your experience in the game.

Some of these armors give massive health boosts, while some increase the amount of damage you deal. Today, we hope to answer which armor set you should be looking for, which ones are the best, and how you obtain them.

Updated on October 17, 2025, by Mark Sammut: Ghost of Yotei is officially out, so most people are probably playing through Atsu's story as we speak. However, Jin's journey will not be forgotten anytime soon, and Ghost of Tsushima will continue to be discovered indefinitely. Consequently, we have added an intro section going over the general importance of armor sets and upgrades.

How Important Are Armor Sets And Upgrades In GoT?

Ghost of Tsushima is not a particularly difficult game, and a major reason is that Sucker Punch gives players versatile tools to deal with most situations. As you play through the campaign, you will gradually unlock new armor sets that have very different bonuses that are clearly designed to emphasize playstyles, be it stealth or direct combat. Unlike some other games where it might be best to stick with one set, GoT encourages you to constantly swap out armor depending on your circumstances, so do not be afraid to experiment and change things.

Now, this raises a bit of an issue when it comes to armor upgrades, as it can be difficult to know which pieces are worth upgrading. Firstly, you should prioritize your katana above everything else, as it will be by your side throughout the campaign. With the Director's Cut and New Game+, GoT has 15 armor sets, 12 of which can be upgraded four times. For the first act, try to avoid wasting resources on upgrading armor, as you should mostly be fine with the base version. This will also give you ample time to discover your preferred type of character, so you can then upgrade the armor sets that fit your preferred build type. In Act 3 and New Game +, you will want to upgrade 2/3 sets completely.

14 Deadly Rival’s Attire

Dress Like A Gruff Antagonist

Special Effects

  • Massive Health Increase
  • Major Melee Damage Increase
  • +30% Ghost Weapon Damage

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Inari
  • Charm of Versatile Skills
  • Charm of Silence
  • Charm of Terrifying Aim
  • Charm of Fortune I
  • Charm of Fortune II

Contrary to Jin Sakai’s sleek Ghost armor and more honorable samurai armor, his eventual rival Ryuzo would opt for a messier attire — complete with a hat that concealed most of his face for the added thrill. Players with earlier versions of the game can dress similarly with the Deadly Rival’s Attire . When equipped, this armor will enhance a player’s Ghost of Tsushima gameplay with boosts to Health as well as melee and Ghost weapon damage.

Originally, players could only get this armor during New Game + from Baku the Voiceless for 50 Ghost Flowers. However, this armor became a separate dye for the Kensei Armor with Patch 2.04 with the Director’s Cut . Still, the Deadly Rival’s Attire is very much designed for late-game playthroughs, and new players will not get a chance to give it a go. New Game+ is slightly harder than the vanilla version of Ghost of Tsushima , so this armor set's effects can be useful; that said, the game is really not that hard, and most fully upgraded gear should be good enough.

13 Archery Master’s Attire

Brag About That Accuracy

Special Effects

  • +45% Nocking and Reload Speed
  • +3 Seconds Total Concentration
  • +50% Concentration on Headshots

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Izanagi
  • Charm of Azumi-no-Isora
  • Charm of Efficiency
  • Charm of Concentration
  • Charm of Fortune I
  • Charm of Fortune II

Unlocked only during a New Game+ playthrough, Jin Sakai can only wear the Archery Master’s Attire from Baku the Voiceless for 25 Ghost Flowers. Upon acquisition, wearing the Archery Master’s Attire in one’s Ghost of Tsushima gameplay will grant Jin with bonuses as long as he’s using the Longbow and the Half Bow - increased nocking and reload speed, additional Concentration, and even half Concentration recovery on a headshot.

The attire itself consists of traditional archery attire with a lower half seemingly dirtied by mud. The attire itself is the same attire worn by Sensei Ishikawa. Although Patch 2.04 of the Director’s Cut removed the armor and turned it into a dye for Tadayori’s Armor, the Steam release of Ghost of Tsushima gave this as a reward for players who linked their PlayStation account to their Steam account.

12 Fundoshi

Fresh From The Hot Springs

Special Effects

  • Running and Sprinting no longer cause noise
  • Lv2: -40% Enemy Detection Speed

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Hidden Blades
  • Charm of Hoori-no-Mikoto (Hunt)
  • Charm of Advantage
  • Charm of Shadows
  • Charm of Silence
  • Charm of Hidden Sight

Badass protagonists often have their “barely had the time to get dressed” moment of unadulterated awesomeness, and Jin Sakain has the Fundoshi as his example of such an occasion. Acquired after finding and resting at 18 Hot Springs, this garb allows players to dress Jin in a fundoshi or traditional Japanese underwear… and settle with that.

However, the attire isn’t without its perks. Somehow, while wearing this, Jin will no longer make noise whenever he runs or sprints. Not only that, upgrading this undergarment will reduce enemy detection speed by 40%. Despite being barely clothed, the attire is similar to the opening attire of Dante from Devil May Cry , wherein the opening segment would have Dante slowly dress himself up as demons suddenly attack the trailer he’s staying in.

11 Hero of Tsushima Armor

Become A Myth, Not A Ghost

Special Effects

  • Major Health Increase
  • Moderate Damage Reduction
  • Lv2: Massive Health Increase
  • Lv2: Major Damage Reduction

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Versatile Skills
  • Charm of Amaterasu (Sun)
  • Charm of Resistance III
  • Charm of Ferocity
  • Charm of Precision
  • Charm of Resolve II

Originally worn by Harunobu Adachi, Tsushima Island’s best swordsman, the Hero of Tsushima is a complete armor set that will be granted to Jin Sakai as he aids in the defense of Tsushima Island. The Clan Adachi origins of Harunobi Adachi are reflected in the armor, as its symbolism and colors reflect the clan. This makes the armor seemingly a direct “upgrade” to the Samurai Clan Armor.

When equipped, the armor extends its near-mythical status to Jin, endowing him with a boost in Health and damage reduction - two stats that will increase by a large amount when the armor is upgraded during New Game +. The game can be originally acquired via the Digital Deluxe, Digital Deluxe Upgrade, Special Edition, and Collector’s Edition of Ghost of Tsushima . The mythical status of the armor made its way to Ghost of Tsushima: Legends as one of the wearable gear of the Samurai Class.

10 Traveler's Attire

Uncover the Fog of War And Discover Secrets

Special Effects

  • Tracks artifacts with guiding wind
  • Clears 10% more fog of war from the map
  • The controller vibrates when Jin is within 30 meters of an artifact

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Inari
  • Charm of Versatile Skills
  • Charm of Silence
  • Charm of Terrifying Aim
  • Charm of Fortune I
  • Charm of Fortune II

As stated by the armor, it is "perfect for those with a long journey ahead." It is most likely given to you as your first armor set because all you need to do is talk to a merchant and they hand it over to you. It fits the appearance of a wanderer extremely well, while also giving the player bonuses that help them discover every artifact they can.

With this armor, players can set their guiding winds to track the different artifacts they can discover, while at the same time clearing more fog of war off the map and providing spider-sense-like artifact abilities that make the controller vibrate whenever one is close by.

9 Tadayori's Armor

Become An Expert Archer

Special Effects

  • Increases nocking and reload speed by 15%
  • Increases concentration time by 1 second
  • Headshots restore 25% of the concentration meter

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Izanagi
  • Charm of Azumi-no-Isora
  • Charm of Efficiency
  • Charm of Concentration
  • Charm of Fortune I
  • Charm of Fortune II

For players who enjoy using the bow to its fullest extent, Tadayori's Armor may be the right choice. All players know that the combat in Ghost of Tsushima doesn't really allow for all ranged combat, but this armor certainly helps by increasing concentration time, reload and draw speeds, and adding more time to the concentration meter with each headshot.

Watch out though, because this armor doesn't offer any increase to health or defense, so players will remain a little squishy with it. Those still interested in this amazing archer's armor can receive it for completing the Legend of Tadayori mythic tale.

8 Ronin Attire

The Classic Samurai Outfit

Special Effects

  • Reduces enemy detection speed by 10%
  • Moderate increase to melee damage
  • After leaving pampas grass, enemies take longer to detect Jin

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Takemikazuchi (Sword)
  • Charm of Nigihayahi-no-Mikoto (Sky)
  • Charm of Inari's Might
  • Charm of Dual Destruction II
  • Charm of Ferocity
  • Charm of Hachiman's Favor

For players who want to look like every other classic samurai movie protagonist, look no further than the Ronin Attire. It is perfect for players who want to charge into battle but still love to sneak around since it gives bonuses to both stealth and melee damage.

Not only that, but it decreases the enemy detection speed whenever the player leaves tall grass. Now when players inevitably get caught sneaking around Mongol territory, they can fight their way out with style. This armor set is acquired by completing the mission Blood on the Grass, which is unlocked during act one.

7 Samurai Clan Armor

Best Armor for Pure Defense

Special Effects

  • Reduces all damage by a moderate amount
  • Moderate increase to health
  • Taking damage grants 15% resolve

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Versatile Skills
  • Charm of Amaterasu (Sun)
  • Charm of Resistance III
  • Charm of Ferocity
  • Charm of Precision
  • Charm of Resolve II

The Samurai Clan Armor is perfect for players who aren't so good at parrying and can't help but take damage. It provides some much-needed resolve each time the player takes damage while increasing maximum health and reducing the damage taken. It's clear that Sucker Punch knew there would be people struggling to keep the Mongols from killing them.

This armor is given early in the game by Lady Masako, during the first mission the player completes for her.

6 Sakai Clan Armor

Massive Increase to Standoff Streaks

Special Effects

  • Moderate increase to melee damage
  • Moderate increase to health
  • Increases standoff streak by 1 and gives a 10% chance to terrify enemies when winning a standoff

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Amaterasu (Sun)
  • Charm of Inari
  • Charm of Hachiman's Favor
  • Charm of Inari's Might
  • Charm of Ferocity
  • Charm of Resolve II

Gamers can all agree that there is something magical about standing off against an enemy, waiting for him to strike, and then cutting him down with a single blow. It's a classical move in many samurai films that is beautifully brought to life in Ghost of Tsushima .

For those who love charging into battle with a family insignia in armor that may or may not bring back haunting memories of watching one's father die, then try out the Sakai Clan Armor. It increases the player's standoff streak up to five when fully upgraded, while also increasing maximum health and damage. Jin can receive it from the story mission Ghosts from the Past.

5 Kensei Armor

Increases Effectiveness of Ghost Weapons

Special Effects

  • 30% increase to resolve gains
  • Ghost weapons deal more damage
  • Hitting an enemy with a ghost weapon makes them take more damage and deal less damage

Best Charms to Use

  • Charm of Hidden Blades
  • Charm of Hoori-no-Mikoto (Hunt)
  • Charm of Advantage
  • Charm of Shadows
  • Charm of Silence
  • Charm of Hidden Sight

While similar in look to the Ronin Attire, this armor is slightly better and is more focused on giving bonuses to players who like to use ghost weapons. What makes this armor so useful is the devastating bonus that reduces the damage an enemy struck by ghost weapons causes.

That same ability also decreases the enemy's defense. On top of that bonus, this armor also increases all resolve gains and increases the damage dealt by all ghost weapons. Remember sticky bombs? Those can now pack a serious punch to a lot of enemies. This armor is found by completing the Six Blades of Kojiro mythic tale in act two.

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A's Mable is the Pokemon Professor I Never Knew I Wanted
item.description:
Pokemon Legends: Z-A , like its Arceus-driven predecessor, breaks a lot of Pokemon conventions in a spirited fashion. From its real-time combat to its narrow scope focused on Lumiose City, Pokemon Legends: Z-A does a lot to set itself apart from the mainline games. At the same time, certain traditions survive, including the time-honored Pokemon professor character archetype. I've been playing Pokemon games long enough to remember a whole host of scruffy-haired older men eager to teach young Trainers-in-training; since then, new professors have broken the mold of that archetype many times over, but if you ask me, Mable arguably does it best.

Unlike most professors, who are newly made for their particular games, Mable has some history in the Pokemon series already. She was a minor character in Pokemon X and Y , a researcher for Team Flare. In the five years that have apparently passed since then, she's changed a lot, becoming the acting director of the Pokemon Research Lab in Professor Sycamore's stead. That's all well and good, but what first caught my attention is that Mable is kind of a jerk. She's got a short temper and doesn't mince words with the player or anyone else, much like in X and Y. That got me thinking about all the other ways Mable cuts against the grain, and becomes one of the best Pokemon professors as a result.

Mable is arguably a bit part in Pokemon X and Y , but she enjoyed a much more robust supporting role in Pokemon the Series and the Pokemon Adventures manga.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Makes Mable's Faults Into Her Greatest Strengths

Whether a Pokemon professor is a dapper younger man, a warm-hearted klutz, or a wizened elder, they almost always have one thing in common: they're nice. Mable, oftentimes, is not. The first thing she does in Pokemon Legends: Z-A is call someone an "incompetent nitwit" in the middle of a tirade about Lumiose City's new Wild Zones. Game Freak establishes right off the bat that Mable is an angry person — but not a cruel one. She's angry because she cares. Her frustrations may boil over sometimes, but that's only because she wants the best for Lumiose's wild Pokemon. In my eyes, allowing her to be flawed makes her a more complete person than some past professors.

To underline that ponit, her relationship with the player doesn't start from a place of altruism, as is the case for many other professors. Mable doesn't meet the player by giving them a free Pokemon; she was dangling a carrot on a stick, hoping some capable trainer would show up with five Pokedex entries in exchange for a prize, and admits to your face that this was her plan to lure in a lackey to do her field research. From that point, Mable readily acknowledges the player's talents, but doesn't fawn over them either. She wants you to get to work, and if you give her attitude (which I did), she'll answer in kind. It's a testy relationship that I think is very funny, and very memorable.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A is Mable's Fresh Start

I don't think the redemption arc aspect should be left out either. I fully admit I'm a sucker for redemption arcs (in middle school, I always named my Pokemon trainer Zuko) so I find it pretty exciting to meet a professor who's undergoing an implicit redemption. Mable was fairly callous during her tenure under Lysandre, helping create an apocalyptic scenario where only Team Flare survives, but now she's using her research to help everyone, human and Pokemon, in Lumiose City. Given that Team Flare used to work for the common good, Mable is returning to her roots, but her role model is Professor Sycamore now, not Lysandre.

Mable is Another Stage of Pokemon's Growth

I didn't expect Mable to be one of my favorite parts of Pokemon Legends: Z-A so far, but she is. Thanks to the recent major Pokemon leaks, I'm already wondering how Gen 10 will handle professors. Pokemon Scarlet and Violet 's professors made some creative choices too, so I have plenty of reason to hope that Pokemon will continue exploring new possibilities with this central character type. For now, though, I'll see what other research tasks Mable has for me.

16
4.9 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A
